title: fututre
content:
The field property is used to change the field that the value property is bound to. This is useful if you want to change the field that the value property is bound to without having to re-create the Ext.form.field.ComboBox.

For example, you may want to display a Ext.form.field.ComboBox in a toolbar, but have the value bound to a hidden field in the form.

Here is an example of changing the field that the value property is bound to:

Ext.create('Ext.form.Panel', {
    title: 'Duck',
    width: 300,
    bodyPadding: 10,
    renderTo: Ext.getBody(),
    items: [{
        xtype: 'textfield',
        name: 'search',
        emptyText: 'search',
        fieldStyle: 'text-align: center;',
        fieldLabel: 'Search',
        labelWidth: 50,
        labelAlign: 'right',
        labelSeparator: '',
        labelStyle: 'font-weight:bold;'
    }, {
        xtype: 'textfield',
        name: 'hidden',
        fieldStyle: 'text-align: center;',
        value: 'hidden value'
    }],
    dockedItems: [{
        xtype: 'toolbar',
        dock: 'bottom',
        items: [{
            xtype: 'combobox',
            fieldLabel: 'Field',
            labelWidth: 50,
            labelAlign: 'right',
            labelSeparator: '',
            labelStyle: 'font-weight:bold;',
            store: [
                ['textfield', 'Textfield'],
author: Dipan Jatt
